Eleven states and Union Territories have achieved 100 percent coverage.

items.title: India's factory growth improves slightly in January, PMI shows

Input costs increased, but output price inflation eased, indicating limited pricing power for manufacturers.

Asset monetisation is also being prioritized over outright PSU privatization.

items.summary: Credit-linked subsidies, start-up support and veterinary expansion announced

items.title: Union Budget 2026: Marginal hike in allocations for Social Justice Dept., Tribal Affairs Ministry
items.summary: The Social Justice Department’s allocation for 2026-27 is ₹13,687.59 crore and the Tribal Affairs Ministry has been allocated ₹15,421.97 crore; the allocations have increased by 16.69% and 42.47% respectively compared with their respective Revised Estimates for the current fiscal

items.title: Union Budget 2026: Allocation for Labour Ministry intact; Budget ignored unemployment, say trade unions
items.summary: Trade unions said the Budget reduced capital investment to corporate investment

items.title: Himachal CM Sukhu terms Union Budget ‘inequitable’, raises concerns over Finance Commission report
items.summary: Himachal Pradesh CM Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu said the Budget overlooked the concerns and priorities of Himachal Pradesh, even as he raised serious concerns regarding the recently tabled 16th Finance Commission

items.title: Budget 2026: Urban push to reshape realty demand beyond metros
items.summary: The Union Budget is set to transform property demand significantly. By accelerating urbanisation, it will invigorate city economies and foster new property opportunities beyond the traditional hubs. Urban centres stand to become vital growth engines, with real estate gaining from enhanced connectivity and the clustering of jobs.

items.title: Budget 2026 is a slow-cooked recipe for wholesome consumption: Nyrika Holkar
items.summary: The government has chosen to prioritise investment, productivity and job creation. Public capex remains the backbone of the budget, with continued emphasis on infrastructure, manufacturing, logistics and industrial ecosystems. Alongside this, the sustained focus on micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs), startups and skilling is significant. These areas are central to sustained employment generation and income growth, particularly for young workers and small enterprises that anchor our local economies.

items.title: Farm jam: Budget bets on nuts, cocoa, fisheries to boost agri value
items.summary: India's latest budget places a strong emphasis on high-value agricultural products and supporting industries. This forward-thinking approach not only aims to cut down on imports but also seeks to elevate farmers' earnings and increase export potential.

items.title: Fiscal prudence coupled with sustained RAM focus
items.summary: The Union Budget 2026 has announced incremental measures to strengthen India’s rural economy.

items.title: Centre to go big on asset monetisation for collecting ₹80,000 cr under ‘Miscellaneous Capital Receipts’
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said 10 per cent of nominal GDP growth is realistic

items.title: Union Budget: REC, PFC set for rejig to scale up power financing
items.summary: As per industry officials, the announcement suggests a move toward modernising their business models, which may include better risk management and adoption of market-driven approaches.

items.title: Budget 2026: Two more years of easier duty on key inputs for electronics
items.summary: The exemptions, which were due to expire in March, will now remain in place for another two years, according to the memorandum to the Finance Bill, 2026. The move removes the risk of near-term price increases that manufacturers had been weighing in case the benefits were to be withdrawn.

items.title: A Budget of Calibrated Ambition: Reading FY27 fiscal tea leaves
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's Budget 2026-27 prioritizes stability and resilience. The fiscal deficit remains controlled, while capital expenditure sees a historic rise. Strategic sectors like electronics and biopharma receive a boost. The services sector, a key growth driver, gains renewed emphasis with tax reforms. Direct tax laws are simplified.

items.title: 16th Finance Commission keeps states’ tax share at 41%
items.summary: The Sixteenth Finance Commission proposes ending revenue deficit grants for states, keeping their tax share at 41%. It introduces states' GDP contribution to tax devolution and demands stricter fiscal discipline. Local body grants will be performance-linked. Disaster grants are enhanced. States must disclose off-budget borrowings. This marks a shift to compliance-driven fiscal federalism.

items.title: Union Budget an inspiring blueprint for building ‘Viksit Bharat’, says U.P. CM
items.summary: Budget will provide opportunities to the youth, security to farmers, encouragement to entrepreneurs, relief to the middle class, respect to workers, and new impetus for innovation, says Adityanath

items.title: Build, India, Build: Govt assures backing for infrastructure developers
items.summary: A new partial credit guarantee fund will support private developers. This will help lenders by reducing risks. Investments will flow into long-gestation and urban infrastructure projects. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman stated the fund aims to boost private sector confidence. This initiative will lower capital costs, making public services more affordable.

items.title: Budget 2026 lays the groundwork for competitive manufacturing, resilient supply chains & inclusive growth, Anish Shah says
items.summary: Budget 2026: India's latest budget prioritizes manufacturing and supply chain strength for Viksit Bharat. It boosts public spending and outlines fiscal responsibility. The plan supports electric mobility and energy transition with new incentives. Investments in infrastructure and rural development aim to drive economic progress. This budget sets a clear path for India's future growth and self-reliance.

items.title: High-level panel to review bank ownership and consolidation for Viksit Bharat
items.summary: A new committee will review India's banking sector. It aims to create fewer, larger banks. This will help fund big projects for India's growth. The panel will also look at ownership rules for private banks. This could attract more foreign investors. The goal is to align banks with India's vision for a developed nation by 2047.

items.title: Union Budget 2026: Fiscally conservative, with policy push for key sectors
items.summary: In this post–Union Budget 2026–27 discussion, Poornima Joshi, Resident Editor, businessline, speaks with Editor Raghuvir Srinivasan on what makes the Union Budget 2026–27 distinctive.

items.title: Budget 2026: Customs levy on personal imports halved to 10%; high-end electronic goods, apparel may see lower landed costs
items.summary: The government has also signalled higher duty-free allowances for Indians returning from overseas travel, potentially widening the benefit for frequent flyers and international shoppers. The move could drop the landed cost of everything — from electronics to fashion — that customers import privately, mostly because they are unavailable in India or would be launched later, industry executives said.

items.title: Capex drive to power growth as Budget 2026 hikes investment to sustain growth & modernise logistics
items.summary: Budget 2026: The government has proposed an 8.9% increase in capital spending for the next fiscal, reaching Rs 12.2 lakh crore, with a focus on asset creation in tier 2 and 3 cities. This move aims to stimulate private investment and maintain economic growth, particularly in infrastructure development, with significant allocations to roads and railways.

items.title: View: Beyond basics, clear and present prudence anchors the Budget
items.summary: The Union Budget emphasizes fiscal discipline and growth. It supports ease of doing business and living, boosting employment. Key initiatives target sunrise sectors and MSMEs. Investments in digital infrastructure, tourism, and healthcare are highlighted. Banking reforms and infrastructure project support are also planned. Public capital expenditure remains a priority for infrastructure creation.

items.title: SGB tax change: secondary market buyers lose capital gains exemption from April
items.summary: The move, aimed at curbing arbitrage, is expected to boost government revenue while reducing SGB liquidity and attractiveness for second-hand investors

items.title: Budget 2026: Job creation and skill development top the agenda
items.summary: In an era of economic transformation, the Union Budget puts a spotlight on job creation and skill enhancement, laying the groundwork for a robust manufacturing sector. By championing micro, small, and medium enterprises (MSMEs) and cultivating new industries, this initiative is set to stimulate growth and establish formal employment pathways.

items.title: Borrowing to build: Govt bets on capex as fiscal deficit stays on track
items.summary: Government borrowing is increasingly financing capital expenditure, boosting economic growth potential as effective capital spending surpasses the fiscal deficit. Conservative tax revenue growth, alongside non-tax receipts and asset sales, provides a cushion. While revenue spending is managed, a slight increase in the budget size is observed, with a focus on easing the debt burden towards targets.

items.title: Union Budget 2026: Urbanisation to reshape real estate growth
items.summary: The Union Budget 2026-27 is set to transform India's real estate market. It will boost urbanisation and extend economic opportunities to cities beyond the largest metros. This budget focuses on developing regional economic hubs, integrating tier-2 and tier-3 cities. An allocation of ₹5,000 crore will improve urban infrastructure. This will support housing, retail, and hospitality sectors in smaller urban centers.

items.title: Budget unveils wide-ranging steps to sustain growth momentum: FM
items.summary: In her latest address, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman unveiled a budget dedicated to long-term growth strategies. Highlights include significant investments in the electronics industry and the creation of rare earth corridors aimed at decreasing reliance on imports. Additionally, the budget outlines extensive support for MSMEs through a comprehensive framework.

items.title: Union Budget 2026: MSMEs get three-pronged support plan
items.summary: India is launching a significant support plan for micro, small, and medium enterprises. This initiative will provide equity, liquidity, and professional help to boost businesses. Tax filing timelines are extended, easing compliance burdens. Professional bodies will create training and support tools. Simplified tax rules for manpower supply are also introduced.

items.title: Rs 80,000 crore disinvestment & asset lease target for FY27
items.summary: With an eye on fiscal strength, the government is targeting a significant Rs 80,000 crore through disinvestment and asset monetisation by the end of FY27. Major transactions like the sale of IDBI Bank and Life Insurance Corporation of India are expected to play pivotal roles in achieving this goal. This strategic move illustrates an ongoing commitment to monetising public assets.

items.title: From tax terror to KISS: Why Budget 2026 gets the basics right
items.summary: While the capital expenditure allocation has not increased sharply this year, it comes on the back of a multi-year expansion in public capex, which now stands at over ₹12.2 lakh crore for FY 2026–27

items.title: A Budget that strengthens base
items.summary: The Budget’s focus on rural resilience helps build a more dependable and sustainable demand base, rather than relying on short-term stimuli

items.title: Union Budget 2026-27: Business as usual with capex push, modest fiscal consolidation and risks
items.summary: India's latest budget prioritizes fiscal consolidation with a gentle approach, focusing on capital expenditure to counter elusive private investment and geopolitical risks. The industrial strategy aims to boost electronics, support labor-intensive sectors against rising tariffs, and derisk critical supply chains. However, risks include state fiscal wobbles, potential disruption in rural employment schemes, and neglect of mega-city livability.

items.title: Budget 2026 bets big on services; panel proposed to lift global share to 10% by 2047
items.summary: India plans to significantly boost its global services sector share to ten percent by 2047. A new panel will identify growth areas and assess technology's impact on jobs. The government is emphasizing digital services, health, education, and tourism. Tax holidays are offered for cloud services using Indian data centers.

items.title: Budget 2026: Making India attractive hub for sustained investment
items.summary: India's 2026 budget focuses on predictable growth. It aims to attract global investment with clear tax rules for technology and data centers. Manufacturing in critical areas like defense and advanced electronics is also a priority. Reforms simplify business operations. This strategy positions India for long-term growth and a key role in global supply chains.

items.title: Budget 2026: Manufacturing push, PLI schemes boost domestic production
items.summary: India's new budget champions manufacturing, aiming to significantly increase its contribution to the nation's GDP. Key sectors like semiconductors, electronics, and textiles receive substantial funding. Initiatives like the Biopharma SHAKTI program and production-linked incentives are designed to build domestic capacity and reduce reliance on imports. This strategic focus supports job creation and economic growth.

items.title: Responding to the changing realities
items.summary: A significant highlight of the Budget is its focus on bridging education with employment and enterprise

items.title: Budget 2026 gives biologics & biosimilars a major policy boost
items.summary: India is set to become a global biopharmaceutical manufacturing hub. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced a dedicated ₹10,000 crore program over five years. This initiative focuses on biosimilars and biologics, crucial for treating non-communicable diseases. The move aims to boost manufacturing, regulation, and clinical trials, positioning India for future global competition.

items.title: Budget 2026: Customs relief extended for nuke projects
items.summary: Budget 2026: India's nuclear power ambitions receive a boost. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has extended customs duty exemptions on imports for nuclear projects until 2035. This move supports the nation's goal of increasing nuclear capacity significantly. Both large and small reactors will benefit from this policy. This encourages a cleaner energy future for India.

items.title: Finance Bill 2026 rewrites MAT rules, nudges firms to concessional tax regime
items.summary: India's minimum alternate tax rules are changing significantly from April 1, 2026. The MAT rate will drop to 14%. New MAT credits will not be allowed. Companies can use old MAT credits, but only a quarter of their tax bill each year. This aims to simplify taxes and guide businesses to a lower 22% corporate tax rate.

items.title: Budget 2026: Revival of 200 legacy clusters on the anvil
items.summary: In an exciting move, the government is unveiling a comprehensive plan aimed at rejuvenating 200 historic industrial clusters across the nation. With a substantial ₹3,000 crore budget earmarked for state-of-the-art plug-and-play industrial parks, this initiative promises to elevate infrastructure and technology, enhancing their competitive edge.

items.title: Union Budget 2026 scraps customs duty on aircraft components, boosting Adani and HAL passenger plane plans
items.summary: The Indian budget has eliminated basic customs duty on civilian aircraft components, significantly boosting plans by Adani Group and HAL to manufacture passenger planes domestically. HAL aims to partner with Russia's Sukhoi for the SJ-100, while Adani will assemble Embraer aircraft. A scheme to support local seaplane manufacturing was also announced.

items.title: Budget 2026 bolsters semiconductor mission, boosts component scheme outlay
items.summary: The long-awaited second stage of the India Semiconductor Scheme will be launched, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said, while the electronics component manufacturing scheme (ECMS) outlay will be increased to ₹40,000 crore

items.title: No coercion: Govt places greater trust on taxpayers in Finance Bill 2026
items.summary: India Budget: The Finance Bill 2026 introduces significant changes to the Income Tax Act. Minor and technical tax offenses will no longer lead to criminal proceedings. Instead, these will be resolved through fines and penalties. This move aims to streamline tax processes and ease the compliance burden for businesses.

items.title: Budget 2026: Duty relief for exports to brave trade winds
items.summary: In an effort to support its economy, India is slashing import duties on marine products and footwear, seeking to counterbalance tariffs imposed by the US. Additionally, the government is extending the timelines for exporters in the leather and textile sectors, allowing for improved financial management and reduced uncertainties.

items.title: India Budget: Customs overhaul to cut costs, boost manufacturing
items.summary: India's Union Budget 2026-27 introduces a comprehensive customs overhaul, featuring duty relief for manufacturing and exports, and a single digital window for faster clearances. Measures aim to boost competitiveness in sectors like textiles and footwear, while rationalizing duties on strategic imports to enhance market access with the US.

items.title: Budget 2026 puts India on a new course with Rs 10,000 crore for containers & waterways
items.summary: India plans to launch 20 inland waterways and boost local container manufacturing. A new scheme will support coastal cargo movement. This aims to reduce empty container imports and promote domestic production. Initiatives will also incentivize shifting cargo from road and rail to waterways.

items.title: Union Budget 2026: Railways gets fresh thrust with freight and bullet train corridors
items.summary: India is set to develop seven new high-speed rail corridors spanning 4,000 km, aiming to significantly reduce travel times and promote sustainable transport. These ambitious projects, expected to attract ₹16 lakh crore in investments, will build upon existing bullet train experiences. The government also announced an East-West Dedicated Freight Corridor to enhance cargo movement.

items.title: Union Budget 2026: For investors, a boring budget is a beautiful thing
items.summary: On budget day, investors and savers will notice that life goes on as usual. Despite some tweaks in tax regulations and the investment arena, there are no dramatic upheavals. The updates include slight modifications to the securities transaction tax affecting equity derivatives and capital gains on sovereign gold bonds. Meanwhile, the emphasis on nurturing a vibrant corporate bond market persists.

items.title: Budget 2026: Prudent push for sustainable growth
items.summary: The Indian budget aims for long-term economic growth, competitiveness, and future readiness. It focuses on strategic sectors like nuclear power, data centers, and semiconductors. Incentives are provided for manufacturing and global capability centers. The budget also supports MSMEs with a new growth fund. This plan offers a credible path to boost the economy.

items.title: Union Budget 2026: ₹20,000 crore earmarked for carbon capture, storage scheme
items.summary: An initial allotment of ₹500 crore has been made to the Ministry of Power to commence the research programme

items.title: Strengthening distributed RE via PM Surya Ghar, PM-KUSUM, a budget priority
items.summary: Government has proposed to spend ₹22,000 crore as budget estimate (BE) for FY27 on PM Surya Ghar

items.title: Bringing the future to the present
A budget for difficult times
items.summary: Union Budget sets Centre’s capital expenditure target at ₹12.2 lakh crore; India must stay deeply integrated with global markets, attracting stable long-term investment, says Finance Minister

items.title: New scheme for coconut, cocoa, cashew and sandalwood announced in Budget
items.summary: Allocation for the scheme was ₹350 crore with farmers organisations like All India Kisan Sabha stating that the new initiative was just another rhetoric

items.title: 16th Finance Commission retains States’ devolution share at 41% till FY31
items.summary: Finance Commission keeps states share, grants rise, GDP-based criteria added

items.title: A strategic Budget for India’s future
items.summary: This is a Budget that thinks about India’s future rather than short-term giveaways

items.title: FM Sitharaman takes a shot at securing the future
items.summary: Capex up 22% at ₹17.14 lakh cr; electronics parts manufacture allocation doubled to ₹40,000 cr; SME Growth Fund gets ₹10,000 cr; markets crash on higher STT on F&O

items.title: India’s Budget cuts subsidy for food, fertiliser, fuel cut 5% to ₹4.3 lakh crore
items.summary: The government’s fiscal health is closely tied to its spending on essential social safety nets, such as agricultural subsidies, rural employment programs, and direct farmer transfers

items.title: Union Budget 2026 political reactions: Congress terms reduction for the Jal Jeevan Mission 'cruel'
items.summary: Tamil Nadu's interests were fully ignored in the Budget, says Stalin; PM Modi described the Union Budget as "historic", saying it reflected the aspirations of 140 crore Indians

items.title: Healthcare: The heartbeat of a healthy nation
items.summary: On a broader scale, the government’s vision of India as a global medical value hub demonstrates foresight

items.title: Budget highlights the imperative of an AI literate India
India’s semiconductor moment depends on capability, not just capacity
Budget 2026: Labour-intensive textile sector sees almost 25% jump in funds allocation
items.summary: MSME sector allocation doubled; scheme to revive 200 legacy industrial clusters proposed

items.title: Budget 2026: Railways gets record allocation at ₹2.78 lakh crore with focus on expansion and safety
items.summary: The operating ratio remains tight at 98.9% for FY26. The Railways anticipates this to improve to 98.4% in FY27

items.title: Watch: Union Budget proposals spark political debate ahead of West Bengal polls
items.summary: Infrastructure proposals in the Union Budget, including freight and industrial corridors and tourism projects, have triggered a political clash in West Bengal ahead of Assembly elections, with the BJP pitching development and the TMC calling the announcements political signalling.

items.title: Union Budget 2026: Agri Ministry allocation up 2.6%; farm outfits say FM ignored their demands
items.summary: No hike for Kisan Samman Nidhi; agri research and education budget drops 4.8%; Food and PDS gets 10% hike; new multilingual AI tool, high-value cash crops get extra support; government did not fulfil promises to farmers, says BKS

items.title: What does the Budget offer urban India?
items.summary: The Union Budget 2026 has cut urban development allocations by 11.6%, lowering funding from ₹96,777 crore to ₹85,522 crore. This reduction raises concerns about the sustainability of essential services amid rising challenges such as mass migration, climate change and infrastructure stagnation in cities

items.title: Union Budget bets on long-term wealth over short-term gains
items.summary: The intention behind raising STT is likely to reduce speculative trading, especially short-term, high-frequency trades in derivatives like options

items.title: Seeds of change take root for dairy sector
items.summary: Get ready for exciting initiatives like a major boost in veterinary services and cool tech tools, including a multilingual AI platform called Vistaar to help farmers level up their game

items.title: Employment and the Budget’s strategic choices
items.summary: Amid global uncertainty, the emphasis on scaling up strategic and frontier sectors, alongside labour-intensive industries, reflects an attempt to advance economic growth, strategic security and self-reliance, while expanding employment.

items.title: Union Budget 2026: Parliament gets an allocation of Rs 1,492
items.summary: The Union Budget has allocated significant funds for Parliament's operations. The Lok Sabha will receive Rs 1,009 crore, covering staff, MPs' facilities, and Sansad TV. The Rajya Sabha is allocated Rs 482.99 crore for its secretariat, chairman, deputy chairman, and leader of the opposition. The Vice President's secretariat also receives funds for staff and expenses.

items.title: Why Bharat Vistaar must be built as foundational layer
items.summary: S. Sivakumar advocates for Bharat Vistaar to provide farmers actionable insights, empowering them to make smarter decisions and increase earnings.

items.title: Budget moots comprehensive review of financial sector, PFC, REC to be restructured
items.summary: “Indian banking sector today is characterised by strong balance sheets, historic highs in profitability, improved asset quality and coverage exceeding 98% of villages in the country,” says Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman

items.title: Union Budget 2026: India makes no fresh allocation for Chabahar port in Budget as U.S. increases pressure on Iran​
items.summary: The downturn in India’s relations with Bangladesh is also reflected in the Budget, with allocation halved to ₹60 crore for projects in Bangladesh in the coming year

items.title: Union Budget 2026 boosts skilling drive, ministry allocation sees sharp rise
items.summary: The Union Budget 2026-27 provides a substantial boost to India's skilling initiatives.  The Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship receives a significant allocation of over Rs 9,800 crore.  This funding aims to modernize Industrial Training Institutes and enhance youth employability.  The budget focuses on strengthening the education-to-employment pipeline, creating new opportunities across various cities.

items.title: CBI gets nearly Rs 1105 crore in Union Budget; increase of Rs 46.5 crore
items.summary: The Union Budget 2026-27 has allocated Rs 1,104.98 crore to the CBI, marking a 4.4% increase from the previous fiscal. This funding will support the agency's efforts in tackling emerging crimes like AI and cryptocurrency, alongside conventional offenses and cases referred by higher courts. The allocation also includes provisions for modernization and infrastructure development.

items.title: Budget 2026: Tax holiday for data centres, relaxed safe harbour norms enthuse IT business leaders
items.summary: Budget measures may facilitate global IT and data operations moving to India; boost to GCCs may spur innovation

items.title: India’s AI Push Gets Real in Budget 2026
Exemption on drugs for cancer, rare disease: Patient-first or minimal benefits?
items.summary: The proposal exempted 17 drugs from basic customs duty, reducing it from 5/10% to nil, and another seven rare diseases were exempt from import duties on personal imports of drugs, medicines, and Food for Special Medical Purposes

items.title: Budget positions India deeper into global supply chains
Watch: Union Budget 2026: what’s in it for textile and MSME?
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman had announced a fresh allocation of ₹10,000 crore to the small and medium enterprises (SMEs) growth fund in the Budget speech on Sunday (February 1, 2026), in a bid to give fresh incentives to lakhs of small businesses and enterprises in the country.

items.title: Union Budget 2026 does little to reduce out-of-pocket expenses, medical inflation: experts
items.summary: While exempting 17 cancer medicines from basic customs duty was welcome, there is little evidence to suggest that companies passed on the benefit to the customers in earlier instances

items.title: PM says Budget ‘ambitious’, ‘futuristic’; focus on growth while lowering fiscal deficit, controlling inflation
items.summary: This Budget re-empowers India’s global role, says Modi

items.title: Rs 3,400 crore allocated for Ministry of Minority Affairs
items.summary: The Union Budget for 2026-27 earmarks Rs 3,400 crore for the Ministry of Minority Affairs. This represents an increase from the previous year's estimate. A significant portion, Rs 831.7 crore, is dedicated to educational empowerment for minority students. Central sector schemes and projects receive Rs 1,197.97 crore.

items.title: Budget to boost economy, enhance India’s global competitiveness: India Inc.
items.summary: Industry leaders welcomed steps announced by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, such as raising capital expenditure to ₹12.2 lakh crore for FY27

items.title: Restructuring PFC & REC to improve credit flows, execution discipline in power sector
items.summary: The restructuring of Power Finance Corporation and Rural Electrification Corporation is a transformative move, say experts

items.title: Two TDS tweaks, less hassle
items.summary: Depository route for declarations, online route for relief

items.title: Over 9% rise in Home Ministry budget; Intelligence Bureau sees enhanced allocation
items.summary: The upcoming Population Census 2027 has been allocated ₹6,000 crore; the second phase of Vibrant Villages Programme gets ₹300 crore

items.title: Budget 2026 seen driving cyclical growth, nominal GDP growth pegged at 10% for FY27: Morgan Stanley
items.summary: The Union Budget 2026-27 is set to boost economic growth. Morgan Stanley reports the budget balances fiscal consolidation with growth support. Capital expenditure remains a focus, aiding near-term expansion and future capacity. The budget signals a strategic shift towards manufacturing, particularly in high-value sectors like semiconductors. Support for services exports aims to increase India's global trade share.

items.title: Budget allocation for 'control of pollution' increases
items.summary: The Union Budget 2026-27 boosts funding for pollution control initiatives. Allocations for schemes like the National Clean Air Programme and the Central Pollution Control Board have seen increases. The budget also earmarks funds for Carbon Capture Utilisation and Storage projects. This move signals a commitment to environmental protection and a green transition.

items.title: Mission Mausam gets Rs 1342 crore in Union Budget
items.summary: India is significantly boosting its weather forecasting. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has allocated Rs 1,342 crore for Mission Mausam. This ambitious initiative will use advanced technologies and computing to improve weather monitoring and prediction. The Ministry of Earth Sciences receives a total of Rs 3,789.23 crore. The Deep Ocean Mission also receives funding for exploration and technology development.

items.title: $2 trillion export goal within reach by 2032: Piyush Goyal
items.summary: In an interview with businessline, the Minister highlighted the focus on labour-intensive sectors, boost to data centres and the services sector as well as a calibrated push for SEZ sales in the domestic market

items.title: How much will a cigarette pack cost now as new excise duty takes effect?
items.summary: High-end cigarettes measuring 76 mm will now see price increases of  ₹50-55 per 10-stick pack, varying by brand.

items.title: Air India launches Shanghai-Delhi flight after gap of about six years
items.summary: The inaugural Shanghai-New Delhi flight departed from Shanghai Pudong International Airport, carrying over 230 passengers on board the Boeing 787 aircraft, the Indian Consulate in Shanghai said in a press release.

items.title: Budget 2026: Govt. plans employment boost through tourism sector with upskilling of guides, Buddhist circuit in Northeast
items.summary: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman also said that a National Destination Digital Knowledge Grid to digitally document all places of cultural, spiritual and historic significance would be set up

items.title: Watch: What does the Union Budget 2026 say on direct taxes?
items.summary: The Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman’s direct tax announcements during the Budget 2026 speech marked a major overhaul in India’s tax system. At the heart of the reforms is the new Income Tax Act of 2025, which will replace the decades-old law, from April 2026, with simpler rules and redesigned forms to make compliance easier for ordinary taxpayers.

items.title: Delhi receives Rs 1348 crore from MHA for 2026-27, same as last year's budget allocation
items.summary: Delhi's budget for 2026-27 stands at Rs 1,348 crore, unchanged from the previous year. Chief Minister Rekha Gupta welcomed the allocation. Funds will support revenue and capital projects, including water infrastructure upgrades. A grant for 1984 riot victims and disaster response is also included. Delhi's connection to a high-speed rail network is highlighted as a significant development.

items.title: Budget blow for counter-terror data grid as NATGRID allocation drops 27%
items.summary: National Intelligence Grid (NATGRID) funding has been significantly reduced by 27.11% in the Union Budget 2026-27, with an allocation of Rs 108.98 crore. This marks a substantial decrease from previous years, suggesting a shift in expenditure towards operations rather than infrastructure enhancement for combating terrorism and internal security threats.

items.title: Union Budget 2026: Jammu and Kashmir fund allocation ‘marginally’ up; Ladakh sees around 27% increase
items.summary: “The modest increase of ₹2,000 crore in Central allocations falls far short of addressing the region’s long-standing developmental gap or providing the stimulus required for revival of existing industrial units,” says FCIK

items.title: Govt to borrow record ₹17.2 lakh crore in FY27
items.summary: Fiscal deficit is pegged at 4.3%; the net market borrowings from dated securities are estimated at ₹11.7 lakh crore

items.title: Budget 2026-27: Over Rs 1300 crore allocated for forensic related schemes under MHA
items.summary: The Union Budget 2026-27 earmarks over Rs 1471 crore for upgrading forensic capabilities. Funds will boost safety of women initiatives, modernize Central Forensic Science Laboratories, and establish a National Forensic Data Centre. The Inter-Operable Criminal Justice System receives Rs 550 crore for seamless data sharing. Criminology and Forensic Science sees a significant hike, supporting R&D and regional labs.

items.title: Focus on structural levers of farm income growth, support to MSMEs to sustain consumption tailwinds
items.summary: “Union Budget 2026–27 is not designed to stimulate consumption in the short term”

items.title: Union Budget 2026: Despite sharp dip in actual spends, Jal Jeevan mission retains allocation at ₹67,600 crore
items.summary: Although the allocation last year was significant, the Jal Shakti Ministry, according to the Union Budget documents, expects to spend only about ₹17,000 crore when this financial year ends

items.title: Budget FY27: FMCG industry says focus on MSMEs, infra, rural demand to drive growth
items.summary: Top executives said the budget reflects continuity and resilience, while avoiding short-term populism. They noted that measures such as MAT credit relief, higher public capex, focus on Tier II and III cities, and support for traditional medicine and AYUSH will create sustained demand tailwinds across rural and semi-urban markets.

items.title: Cess on pan masala to fetch Rs 14,000 cr in FY27
items.summary: The government will collect Rs 14,000 crore from a new health and national security cess on pan masala in the next fiscal year. This cess, levied over the 40% GST, aims to create a dedicated resource for health and national security initiatives. The total tax incidence on pan masala will remain at 88%.

items.title: Decoding Budget 2026–27 | What the numbers mean
items.summary: Our reporters join us live to decode the Union Budget 2026–27. We break down sector-wise allocations, policy signals, and what the budget means for states facing elections in 2026.

items.title: Chidambaram rips Into Budget, flags capex cuts, revenue shortfall
items.summary: The senior Congress leader said revenue receipts were short by ₹78,086 crore, total expenditure was short by ₹1,00,503 crore

items.title: Custom duties rejig to promote domestic manufacturing, enhance export competitiveness
items.summary: Experts pointed out that this will also result in lowering of barriers for certain capital-intensive and technology-led exports from the US to India

items.title: Sectoral swings across the last nine Budgets
items.summary: FMCG resilient, Financials sensitive and Oil & Gas lag

items.title: Union Budget instrumental in sailing Bharat towards becoming a top global maritime superpower: Union minister Sarbananda Sonowal
items.summary: The Union Budget is set to boost India's maritime sector and inland waterways. A new Container Manufacturing Assistance Scheme will create jobs and reduce import dependence. Twenty new National Waterways will become operational, promoting greener cargo movement. Training institutes will enhance skills in the waterways sector. These initiatives aim to strengthen India's logistics and achieve self-reliance.

items.title: Centre expects Rs 3.16 lakh cr dividend from RBI, banks in FY27
items.summary: The Centre anticipates Rs 3.16 lakh crore in dividends and surpluses from the RBI, nationalised banks, and financial institutions for 2026-27, a 3.75% increase. This, along with Rs 75,000 crore from public sector enterprises, contributes to an expected Rs 6.66 lakh crore in non-tax revenue for the next fiscal year.

items.title: Budget 2026 lifts aviation outlook, industry sees clear runway for growth
items.summary: India's aviation sector welcomes the Union Budget 2026-27. Industry leaders find clarity and confidence in its focus on fiscal discipline and infrastructure. The budget supports long-term capacity building and sustainable expansion. Initiatives for air connectivity, domestic manufacturing, and tourism are highlighted. This budget signals a pragmatic approach for resilient and sustainable growth in the aviation industry.

items.title: Budget FY27 gives boost to high-speed, multimodal infra creation
items.summary: Public capital expenditure proposed at ₹12.2 lakh crore in FY27 as allocations rise across roads, railways and waterways

items.title: Union Budget 2026: Govt extends nuclear power projects exemption till 2035
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced an extension of basic customs duty exemption for nuclear power project imports until 2035, supporting India's goal of 100 GW atomic energy capacity by 2047. The government also plans to establish Rare Earth Corridors in mineral-rich states to boost domestic capabilities and reduce strategic dependencies.

items.title: Cigarette prices jump up to ₹55 per pack as new excise duty kicks in. Check what gets costlier and by how much
items.summary: Cigarette prices have surged by at least ₹22-25 per pack following a new excise duty. Premium cigarettes will see an increase of ₹50-55 per pack. Distributors are billing existing stock at the new 40 percent GST rate. Revised MRPs are expected by month-end. This hike could encourage smuggling and impact honest retailers.

items.title: Union Budget 2026: Amitabh Kant praises Nirmala Sitharaman for her focus on reducing the country's fiscal deficit
items.summary: Amitabh Kant lauded Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman for fiscal discipline in Budget 2026-27, noting a reduced fiscal deficit to 4.3% of GDP alongside increased capital expenditure. DP World highlighted the Rs 10,000 crore allocation for domestic container manufacturing, while Alstom praised the seven new high-speed rail corridors for boosting mobility and the economy.
